segments.text: The May holiday is coming up soon . Are you planning on going on vacation ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I am . I just went to the travel agent ’ s and picked up these brochures .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Where are you planning on going ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I fancy going to Tibet for a few days . Have you ever been there ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I went a long time ago , before they built the new train that can take you there .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Would you recommend going there for a few days ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Personally , I think it ’ d be better to go when you have more time . A few days isn ’ t really enough to get acclimatize yourself and to go on a few excursions outside of the capital .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You ’ re probably right . What do you think about Yangshao ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s a beautiful city , but I think it ’ s become too touristy . How about going to a cosmopolitan city like Shanghai or Hong Kong ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ d like to get away from the big city life .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Maybe you should consider going to a hot springs resort outside of Beijing . I heard they are very relaxing .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I guess if I only have a few days , I should probably think about going somewhere that isn ’ t so far away .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Since the May holiday is the high season , you should probably call ahead to reserve a room . Here ’ s the phone number .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thanks , I ’ ll give them a call later .
segments.speaker: S2
